elements.name: question9
elements.title: How many people own a car with air conditioning? How did you get Excel to show you the correct number of people?
elements.correctAnswer: Select column I, "Find and select" command, "Replace" tab, search for "Yes", replace with "Yes", "Replace all" button, Excel displays (and executes) the number of replacements. There are 14 people.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: You are looking for the data record of Mr. Rothen or Mr. Roten. What is this customer's first name?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: You can't remember exactly which street someone lives on - something about Sonnenbühlstrasse. What is the correct address (street, street number)? Also explain how you found this address.
elements.correctAnswer:
Sonnbühlstrasse 11 (line 31). 
 "Search and Select" command, "Search" tab, search for "Sonnbühlstrasse", Excel displays the cell name below the search window: $D$31

elements.name: question1
elements.title:
You are looking for a customer whose surname begins with "S". You know that he drives a VW Golf GTI. How did you find this customer? 
Tip: Only search for names beginning with "S" and display them individually.
elements.correctAnswer:
Select column "Name", open search window, search for: S*, with the option "Compare entire cell content", display individually. 
Solution: Ruth Stocker (line 29)
